description: The NSW Education Standards Authority said the temporary removal of Orwell or Dickens comes with the addition of new authors.

description: The Liberal Party has launched a new national advertising campaign over the holidays, focused on the “dangerous cuts” that it says Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre would make if he becomes prime minister. description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has thanked medical and emergency workers and defence force members who have given up their Christmas to help others. description: Billson's Brewery is out of the red as drinks giant Coca-Cola steps in months after the business went into voluntary administration.

description: The Chinese regime has sanctioned 20 Canadian human rights advocates and two organizations that support persecuted Tibetans and Uyghurs in China. title: Canadian Rights Advocates Latest Targets of Beijing’s Sanctions

description: Santa’s sleigh has been authorized for travel in Canadian airspace, just in time for Christmas, Ottawa has announced. description: The Competition Bureau says it’s suing Rogers Communications Inc. over the company’s allegedly false claim that it offers unlimited data in its “Infinte” wireless phone plans. description: Canada’s foreign signals intelligence agency is warning the public about the increasing number of Iranian cyber schemes targeting a wide range of Canadian professionals. description: The Bank of Canada’s governing council expects its second straight outsized interest rate cut helped it turn a corner in its fight to tame inflation, but it is watching the economy closely amid weaker than expected growth. description: The majority of Liberal MPs want Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to step down in the wake of last week’s resignation of his second in command, say MPs Anthony Housefather and Chandra Arya. “I see very few people that think he should stay,” Housefather said during a Dec. 22 interview with CBC. “The vast majority of […]

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will chair a meeting of the cabinet committee on Canada-U.S. relations today, amid increasing calls for his resignation. description: FLORENCE, Italy—For centuries, Florence’s 16th-century Vasari Corridor was only accessible to dukes and lords. Now, the raised passageway that connects the city’s Uffizi Galleries to the former residence of the powerful Medici family, has reopened to the public after an eight-year restoration project. The corridor, named after the Renaissance architect and biographer Giorgio Vasari, who […]
title: Secret Passage That Florence’s Medici Used to Move Safely Reopens to Public After 8-year Renovation
